TITLE: Spaced Repetition
DEF: Learning through revising and reinforcing previously learned material at empirically vaildated, effective intervals
TASK: The Spaced Repetition pattern enables learners to revisit and reinforce previously learned material at increasing intervals, which significantly enhances long-term retention of knowledge. The challenge with this pattern lies in the careful scheduling and regular opportunities for recall. To effectively implement the pattern, educators should design a review schedule, provide regular opportunities for recall, and encourage learners to self-assess and adapt their study habits based on their performance.
